<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/18/top-boeing-pilot-raised-concerns-737-max-safetyin-2016?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boeing Has Read Receipts On
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Boeing Has Read Receipts On" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571432779.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Boeing Has Read Receipts On" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571432779.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In November 2016, the then-chief technical pilot for a Boeing plane model said in instant messages to a fellow pilot that an automated safety system was making it tough to maintain control over planes in flight simulators, Reuters <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ethiopia-airplane-boeing-exclusive/exclusive-boeing-2016-internal-messages-suggest-employees-may-have-misled-faa-on-737-max-sources-idUSKBN1WX25G?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first reported</a> yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The model: 737 Max. The system: Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System, or MCAS.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Those should sound familiar. </strong>The 737 Max was grounded in March following two crashes that killed 346 people in the span of five months. Both of the crashes have been pinned on problems with MCAS.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Back to 2016…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 737 Max was going through its original certification. The pilot who sent the messages in question, Mark Forkner, typed about MCAS, “It’s <a href="https://www.axios.com/boeing-737-max-egregious-issue-mcas-text-messages-fb216bc6-7748-4428-9270-4d87f9cc75b8.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">running rampant</a> in the sim on me." Later in the thread, he wrote to his colleague, "Granted, I suck at flying, but even this was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/18/business/boeing-flight-simulator-text-message.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">egregious</a>."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How did the 737 Max get off the ground in the first place?</strong> Eight months before he sent those messages, Forkner asked the FAA to remove mention of MCAS from the 737 Max pilot manual. The FAA obliged, assuming at the time that MCAS would only activate infrequently.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But then, Forkner started feeling like you after last night’s 11pm “what’s up” went unanswered.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“So I basically lied to the regulators (unknowingly),” Forkner wrote in the instant message thread. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">FYI, from Forkner’s lawyer: “I<span>t is obvious that there was no ‘lie’ and the simulator program was not operating properly</span>...Mark thought the plane was safe, and the simulator would be fixed.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why are we just hearing this now? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Boeing handed the messages over to the Justice Dept. in February but did not alert the Transportation Department until Thursday night. Yesterday, the FAA said it was “disappointed that Boeing did not bring this document to our attention immediately upon its discovery.” Boeing stock fell nearly 7% on the day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Boeing is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-18/faa-says-boeing-was-tardy-in-turning-over-737-max-evidence?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting its docs in order</a> for an Oct. 30 hearing, during which Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg will testify about the 737 Max crashes for the first time.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F18%2Ftop-boeing-pilot-raised-concerns-737-max-safetyin-2016" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Why+are+we+just+hearing+about+this+now%3F+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/18/top-boeing-pilot-raised-concerns-737-max-safetyin-2016&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/18/oracle-boss-mark-hurd-dies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oracle Boss Mark Hurd Dies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Oracle Boss Mark Hurd Dies" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNDMxNzg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, <span>Oracle co-CEO</span> and longtime Silicon Valley figure Mark Hurd <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/18/tech/mark-hurd-dead/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died at</a> age 62. He had been on a medical leave of absence since Sept. 11. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hurd got his start as a salesman at National Cash Register, where he spent 25 years and worked his way up to land the top job.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He never lost his taste for sales, eventually </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-18/mark-hurd-oracle-ceo-who-led-three-tech-companies-dies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overseeing</a></span><span> and reshaping the division at Oracle. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But we’re getting ahead of ourselves.</strong> Between NCR and Oracle, Hurd had a noteworthy stint as CEO of Hewlett-Packard beginning in 2005. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hurd resigned from HP in 2010 after a scandal over his relationship with a female contractor. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>His move to Oracle, one of HP’s main competitors, was no less controversial. HP </span><span><a href="http://www.nbcnews.com/id/39276575/ns/business-us_business/t/hurd-gives-million-settle-hp-lawsuit/#.XaobhpNKhTY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a></span><span> to try and block his move. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Safra Catz, who’d been Hurd’s co-CEO, will <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/oracle-says-co-ceo-mark-hurd-has-died-11571414910?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go it alone</a>, with Larry Ellison serving as executive chairman and CTO. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> According to Fortune’s <a href="https://fortune.com/2019/10/18/mark-hurd-oracle-co-ceo-remembering/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Adam Lashinsky</a>, Hurd was an impressive executive who was less concerned about technology and more comfortable as a “buttoned-up business guy.”</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/18/frustrated-lebanese-take-streets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
WhatsApp Tax Is Lebanon’s Tipping Point
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="WhatsApp Tax Is Lebanon’s Tipping Point" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNDI4MTgyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sam Tarling/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, people in Lebanon <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/lebanese-protests-triggered-by-whatsapp-tax-rattle-government-11571413218?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit the streets</a> to protest what they call mismanagement by the country’s political elite. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Lebanon <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/lebanon-protests-economic-crisis-corruption-continue-191018132945814.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is in</a> an economic crisis. Government debt is at 150% of GDP, the third highest <span>debt level</span> in the world. Meanwhile, quality of life is far from 150%—infrastructure is crumbling, services are unreliable, and unemployment is rampant. Plus, there’s been a stubborn pattern of government corruption. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On top of all that, wildfires ravaged Lebanon’s Chouf Mountains this week.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The tipping point: </strong>Yesterday, the government proposed, then hours later rescinded, a $0.20 daily tax on calls made through WhatsApp and similar apps. Protesters called for the resignation of Prime Minister Saad al-Hariri and some of his associates. Some chanted “revolution,” dredging up memories of 2011’s Arab Spring. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The protests, the country’s largest since 2015, immobilized the capital Beirut and several other cities. Schools and businesses shut down as </span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/lebanon-protests-planned-tax-whatsapp-calls-triggers-unrest-beirut-nationwide-today-2019-10-18/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">protesters blocked</a></span><span> major roads. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two people were killed and dozens were injured. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>midday yesterday, <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-50095448?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">al-Hariri set</a> a 72-hour deadline for the government to resolve the crisis. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/18/milliondollar-homes-getting-smaller?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Honey I Shrunk the Million-Dollar Homes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Honey I Shrunk the Million-Dollar Homes" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNDI5MTQ2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Across the U.S., the square footage of $1 million homes is shrinking. Coincidentally, so is our patience for being blamed for “killing” everything. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What millennials did this time: </strong>They comprise the <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/brendarichardson/2019/10/17/from-condos-to-mansions-what-1-million-gets-you-in-todays-housing-market/#2389503a56af?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest share</a> of homebuyers at 37%. As they <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-18/nashville-s-million-dollar-homes-are-shrinking-fastest-in-u-s?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">put down roots</a> in cities like Nashville with 1) lots of jobs 2) luxury downtown apartments and 3) a thriving bachelorette party economy, housing demand has soared. And prices have followed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">By the numbers</strong>, c/o <a href="https://www.zillow.com/research/what-1-million-gets-you-25747/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Zillow</a> data cited by Bloomberg: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Nashville, $1 million gets you 3,637 sq. ft., down 28% from five years ago. Related data point: Music City’s unemployment rate is 2.7%. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In NYC, you’ll get 1,725 sq. ft., or roughly the size of your first three apartments combined.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In San Francisco, $1 million means just 1,150 sq. ft. and book club hosting duties for the rest of time.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Nationwide, million-dollar homes average 2,192 sq. ft., down 14% from 2014...but you can still squeeze in 4 bedrooms and 2.5 baths, Zillow says.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So <em>That's</em> the Blob
</font></a>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, a Paris zoo is debuting "<a href="https://www.sciencealert.com/paris-zoo-s-new-blob-exhibit-is-no-monster-but-something-we-can-all-learn-from?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Blob</a>," a unique slime mold that has 720 sexes and traces its origin to about 1 billion years ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Kxtp2Z9eSo4Peh329D/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xORG3MUPk9s&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Parc zoologique de Paris on YouTube </em></a></sup></p>

!mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Boeing Has Read Receipts On\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571432779.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn November 2016, the then-chief technical pilot for a Boeing plane model said in instant messages to a fellow pilot that an automated safety system was making it tough to maintain control over planes in flight simulators, Reuters \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ethiopia-airplane-boeing-exclusive/exclusive-boeing-2016-internal-messages-suggest-employees-may-have-misled-faa-on-737-max-sources-idUSKBN1WX25G?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst reported\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe model: 737 Max. The system: Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System, or MCAS.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThose should sound familiar. \u003c/strong\u003eThe 737 Max was grounded in March following two crashes that killed 346 people in the span of five months. Both of the crashes have been pinned on problems with MCAS.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBack to 2016…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe 737 Max was going through its original certification. The pilot who sent the messages in question, Mark Forkner, typed about MCAS, “It’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/boeing-737-max-egregious-issue-mcas-text-messages-fb216bc6-7748-4428-9270-4d87f9cc75b8.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erunning rampant\u003c/a\u003e in the sim on me.\" Later in the thread, he wrote to his colleague, \"Granted, I suck at flying, but even this was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/18/business/boeing-flight-simulator-text-message.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eegregious\u003c/a\u003e.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow did the 737 Max get off the ground in the first place?\u003c/strong\u003e Eight months before he sent those messages, Forkner asked the FAA to remove mention of MCAS from the 737 Max pilot manual. The FAA obliged, assuming at the time that MCAS would only activate infrequently.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut then, Forkner started feeling like you after last night’s 11pm “what’s up” went unanswered.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“So I basically lied to the regulators (unknowingly),” Forkner wrote in the instant message thread. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFYI, from Forkner’s lawyer: “I\u003cspan\u003et is obvious that there was no ‘lie’ and the simulator program was not operating properly\u003c/span\u003e...Mark thought the plane was safe, and the simulator would be fixed.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy are we just hearing this now? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoeing handed the messages over to the Justice Dept. in February but did not alert the Transportation Department until Thursday night. Yesterday, the FAA said it was “disappointed that Boeing did not bring this document to our attention immediately upon its discovery.” Boeing stock fell nearly 7% on the day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBoeing is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-18/faa-says-boeing-was-tardy-in-turning-over-737-max-evidence?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting its docs in order\u003c/a\u003e for an Oct. 30 hearing, during which Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg will testify about the 737 Max crashes for the first time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F18%2Ftop-boeing-pilot-raised-concerns-737-max-safetyin-2016\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNDMxNzg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJustin Sullivan/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, \u003cspan\u003eOracle co-CEO\u003c/span\u003e and longtime Silicon Valley figure Mark Hurd \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/18/tech/mark-hurd-dead/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied at\u003c/a\u003e age 62. He had been on a medical leave of absence since Sept. 11. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHurd got his start as a salesman at National Cash Register, where he spent 25 years and worked his way up to land the top job.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe never lost his taste for sales, eventually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-18/mark-hurd-oracle-ceo-who-led-three-tech-companies-dies?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoverseeing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and reshaping the division at Oracle. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut we’re getting ahead of ourselves.\u003c/strong\u003e Between NCR and Oracle, Hurd had a noteworthy stint as CEO of Hewlett-Packard beginning in 2005. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHurd resigned from HP in 2010 after a scandal over his relationship with a female contractor. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHis move to Oracle, one of HP’s main competitors, was no less controversial. HP \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.nbcnews.com/id/39276575/ns/business-us_business/t/hurd-gives-million-settle-hp-lawsuit/#.XaobhpNKhTY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to try and block his move. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSafra Catz, who’d been Hurd’s co-CEO, will \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/oracle-says-co-ceo-mark-hurd-has-died-11571414910?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ego it alone\u003c/a\u003e, with Larry Ellison serving as executive chairman and CTO. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e According to Fortune’s \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2019/10/18/mark-hurd-oracle-co-ceo-remembering/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAdam Lashinsky\u003c/a\u003e, Hurd was an impressive executive who was less concerned about technology and more comfortable as a “buttoned-up business collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, people in Lebanon \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/lebanese-protests-triggered-by-whatsapp-tax-rattle-government-11571413218?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit the streets\u003c/a\u003e to protest what they call mismanagement by the country’s political elite. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eLebanon \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/lebanon-protests-economic-crisis-corruption-continue-191018132945814.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis in\u003c/a\u003e an economic crisis. Government debt is at 150% of GDP, the third highest \u003cspan\u003edebt level\u003c/span\u003e in the world. Meanwhile, quality of life is far from 150%—infrastructure is crumbling, services are unreliable, and unemployment is rampant. Plus, there’s been a stubborn pattern of government corruption. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn top of all that, wildfires ravaged Lebanon’s Chouf Mountains this week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe tipping point: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, the government proposed, then hours later rescinded, a $0.20 daily tax on calls made through WhatsApp and similar apps. Protesters called for the resignation of Prime Minister Saad al-Hariri and some of his associates. Some chanted “revolution,” dredging up memories of 2011’s Arab Spring. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe protests, the country’s largest since 2015, immobilized the capital Beirut and several other cities. Schools and businesses shut down as \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/lebanon-protests-planned-tax-whatsapp-calls-triggers-unrest-beirut-nationwide-today-2019-10-18/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprotesters blocked\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e major roads. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo people were killed and dozens were injured. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003emidday yesterday, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-50095448?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eal-Hariri set\u003c/a\u003e a 72-hour deadline for the government to resolve the crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAcross the U.S., the square footage of $1 million homes is shrinking. Coincidentally, so is our patience for being blamed for “killing” everything. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat millennials did this time: \u003c/strong\u003eThey comprise the \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/brendarichardson/2019/10/17/from-condos-to-mansions-what-1-million-gets-you-in-todays-housing-market/#2389503a56af?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest share\u003c/a\u003e of homebuyers at 37%. As they \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-18/nashville-s-million-dollar-homes-are-shrinking-fastest-in-u-s?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eput down roots\u003c/a\u003e in cities like Nashville with 1) lots of jobs 2) luxury downtown apartments and 3) a thriving bachelorette party economy, housing demand has soared. And prices have followed.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBy the numbers\u003c/strong\u003e, c/o \u003ca href=\"https://www.zillow.com/research/what-1-million-gets-you-25747/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eZillow\u003c/a\u003e data cited by Bloomberg: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Nashville, $1 million gets you 3,637 sq. ft., down 28% from five years ago. Related data point: Music City’s unemployment rate is 2.7%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn NYC, you’ll get 1,725 sq. ft., or roughly the size of your first three apartments combined.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn San Francisco, $1 million means just 1,150 sq. ft. and book club hosting duties for the rest of time.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNationwide, million-dollar homes average 2,192 sq. ft., down 14%
